sj224.tflp.util

Class PopupGui

  • java.lang.Object
    • sj224.tflp.util.PopupGui

  • public class PopupGui
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides utility methods for creating simple alerts and prompts.
    Author:
    Johnathan Waugh

      • promptDouble

        public static double promptDouble()
        Produces a prompt box and returns the value the user enters, parsed as a double. If input given is invalid, yields NaN.
        Returns:
        The value entered into the prompt box, parsed as a double

      • promptDouble

        public static double promptDouble(java.lang.String request)
        Produces a prompt box with a given request and returns the value the user enters, parsed as a double. If input given is invalid, yields NaN.
        Parameters:
        request - The request shown in the prompt box
        Returns:
        The value entered into the prompt box, parsed as a double

      • promptInt

        public static int promptInt()
        Produces a prompt box and returns the value the user enters, parsed as an integer.
        Returns:
        The value entered into the prompt box, parsed as an integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - When an invalid input is given

      • promptInt

        public static int promptInt(java.lang.String request)
        Produces a prompt box with a given request and returns the value the user enters, parsed as an integer.
        Parameters:
        request - The request shown in the prompt box
        Returns:
        The value entered into the prompt box, parsed as an integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - When an invalid input is given

      • confirm

        public static boolean confirm(java.lang.String title,
                              java.lang.String text)
        Produces an OK/CANCEL confirm dialogue, and returns a boolean representing the user's response
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the confirm dialogue
        text - The text of the confirm dialogue
        Returns:
        true if the user selects OK, false otherwise
